title: nliban
author: nliban
created_time: July 05, 2022, 07:24:14 PMLast edit: July 05, 2022, 07:40:56 PM by nliban
content: An account newly created is promoting the scam project Partyland in a bounty campaign without any research and after being alerted.Campaign topic : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5405167.0Archived topic: https://archive.ph/nvslwBounty Manager (newbie) : JerZeiProject's forum account : partyland.ioPartyland scam accusation topic : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403696.0The Bounty manager has been alerted about this scam and the scam accusation topic has been sent to him so he can cancel the campaign. But he decided despite all the proofs to keep it running after deleting the messages proving it's a scam. Very unprofessional bounty manager. I don't advice anyone to deal with.Screenshots : https://imgur.com/a/9urfH7tI've added a negative trust for this user.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.created_time: July 05, 2022, 08:15:07 PMLast edit: July 05, 2022, 09:22:41 PM by yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: nliban on July 05, 2022, 07:24:14 PMAn account newly created is promoting the scam project Partyland in a bounty campaign without any research and after being alerted.Campaign topic : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5405167.0Archived topic: https://archive.ph/nvslwBounty Manager (newbie) : JerZeiProject's forum account : partyland.ioPartyland scam accusation topic : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403696.0The Bounty manager has been alerted about this scam and the scam accusation topic has been sent to him so he can cancel the campaign. But he decided despite all the proofs to keep it running after deleting the messages proving it's a scam. Very unprofessional bounty manager. I don't advice anyone to deal with.Screenshots : https://imgur.com/a/9urfH7tI've added a negative trust for this user.Tagged but unfortunately tagging newbie accounts doesn't do much as they will just make a new account and move on with life. This manager seems to be desperate and accepts whatever comes his way.Quote from: JeromeTash on July 05, 2022, 08:48:52 PMScam promoter should be flagged too: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=2999That should be enough to warn any sensible newbies in the bounty section about the user.Great job and Keep track of the scammer, I know he won't give up anytime soon.Excellent idea

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Scam promoter should be flagged too: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=2999That should be enough to warn any sensible newbies in the bounty section about the user.Great job and Keep track of the scammer, I know he won't give up anytime soon.

comments.author: nliban
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on July 05, 2022, 08:48:52 PMScam promoter should be flagged too: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=2999That should be enough to warn any sensible newbies in the bounty section about the user.Great job and Keep track of the scammer, I know he won't give up anytime soon.Thanks mate, I hesitated to add a flag too.I keep following Partyland scammer everywhere, warning people and updating the scam accusation topic. You're right, he never stops trying.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: I have a suspicion that this account is also part of the new bounty manager account that has recently appeared. buy copper members to make their bounty thread. I don't know if such a bounty manager account is paid or not. I instead assume the account is operated by part of their team.although there is already a thread proving the project is a scam. still, there are managers and bounty hunters who just register. It's a shame, that so many bounty hunters don't have the habit of reading first. even when they don't get paid, they claim to be the ones who suffer the most.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Pandu Geddon on July 06, 2022, 02:26:30 AMI have a suspicion that this account is also part of the new bounty manager account that has recently appeared. buy copper members to make their bounty thread. I don't know if such a bounty manager account is paid or not. I instead assume the account is operated by part of their team.I don't think that this account is controlled by Partyland team because this is not the first bounty campaign done by JerZei. Month ago he started Multi Finance bounty campaign which ended up being scam. I guess this is his specialization, scams.  Quote from: Pandu Geddon on July 06, 2022, 02:26:30 AMIt's a shame, that so many bounty hunters don't have the habit of reading first. even when they don't get paid, they claim to be the ones who suffer the most.They do read, but they simply don't care because majority of bounty hunters are using Newbie accounts so even if  they get tagged for promoting scam, its not a big loss for them.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: This is not how a bounty manager should handle a proven scam project. I'm sure they'll come back with a new account, but I'm still adding a negative tag and supporting the flag. Nice catch, nliban!

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: nliban on July 05, 2022, 07:24:14 PMAn account newly created is promoting the scam project Partyland in a bounty campaign without any research and after being alerted.Apparently, bounty hunters should think twice before promoting and joining a project managed by a novice account manager, sadly no one cares, bounty hunters still enroll in such projects.Maybe, if all Bounty campaigns were managed by beginners, without any participants registering and participating I'm sure, project companies will look for managers here who are well-established to manage their projects, if so will avoid the so-called fraudulent project (escrow) running.What was said by: @nliban, obviously the project manager is a scam, the project must be a scam, but there are still participants joining in, I hope that in the future all bounty hunters can think twice before enrolling in the Bounty campaign.

comments.author: nliban
comments.body: yes unfortunately, some hunters don't care. I even dm'ed the most active hunters who are shitposting messages in Partyland telegram group to have more stakes in the campaign, and I sent them the scam accusation topic link, but still, they ignored after reading it and keep posting useless messages. Some still hope they can get something from this scam. And then come and cry when the project doesn't pay. It's not only the BM fault, hunters are also part of the problem.BM needs to do researches and check the projects they are promoting, and hunter have to avoid participating in a scam campaign.Also some BM creates new account to hide the negative trusts on their previous account (like this one https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403197.msg60493379#msg60493379, should be reported also). So they already have their community in their telegram group to share the link of the campaign.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on July 06, 2022, 01:38:05 PMQuote from: nliban on July 05, 2022, 07:24:14 PMAn account newly created is promoting the scam project Partyland in a bounty campaign without any research and after being alerted.Apparently, bounty hunters should think twice before promoting and joining a project managed by a novice account manager, sadly no one cares, bounty hunters still enroll in such projects.Maybe, if all Bounty campaigns were managed by beginners, without any participants registering and participating I'm sure, project companies will look for managers here who are well-established to manage their projects, if so will avoid the so-called fraudulent project (escrow) running.Neither bounty hunter is ever going to check out what is what, nor the project owner is going to change their habit of hiring just anyone who is willing to even work for $50/week or even for the shit token only. That's the problem lol. Only a few bounty hunters care about project and campaign manager. Almost all of them can't evenb read or bother to read a little about the project. How do you expect them have background study of campaign manager?Quote from: nliban on July 06, 2022, 03:10:28 PMBM needs to do researches and check the projects they are promotingVery few BM does that. Maybe yahoo62278 and Hhampuz do that if I'm correct. I used to have my own criteria but sadly I would never be able to a single bounty to manage if I were determined on that standard. Also, if I'm not managing a campaign, there are hundred more managers to do that job without thinkiong twice.

comments.author: nliban
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on July 06, 2022, 05:26:50 PMVery few BM does that. Maybe yahoo62278 and Hhampuz do that if I'm correct. I used to have my own criteria but sadly I would never be able to a single bounty to manage if I were determined on that standard. Also, if I'm not managing a campaign, there are hundred more managers to do that job without thinkiong twice.I've alerted 7 BM about Partyland scam. 4 reviewed the proofs and didn't start the campaign, 1 cancelled the ongoing campaign and 2 banned me to keep running the campaign.Sometimes even all the proofs given is not enough (they didn't even have to do the researches).For those 2 BM, having been paid was enough for them to continue the campaign, and they clearly mentioned that they are not in charge or responsible of the distribution for the hunters.They are either desperate to find a project to promote or are using hunters to make money.In both case, hunters should stop participating in their campaigns. But they still are even when they are aware of the problem..

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: nliban on July 05, 2022, 07:24:14 PMThe Bounty manager has been alerted about this scam and the scam accusation topic has been sent to him so he can cancel the campaign. But he decided despite all the proofs to keep it running after deleting the messages proving it's a scam. Very unprofessional bounty manager. I don't advice anyone to deal with.A brand new copper member which means this is not a BM who has experience of work and regularly launching bounty campaigns. Most possibly this is one of their internal employee who decided to create an account and started the bounty. Quote from: nliban on July 06, 2022, 06:40:23 PMIn both case, hunters should stop participating in their campaigns. But they still are even when they are aware of the problem.. The hunters are not even reading the forum. They post proof of authentication and start shilling in social media.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: nliban on July 06, 2022, 03:10:28 PMyes unfortunately, some hunters don't care. I even dm'ed the most active hunters who are shitposting messages in Partyland telegram group to have more stakes in the campaign, and I sent them the scam accusation topic link, but still, they ignored after reading it and keep posting useless messages. Participation in a bounty for hunters is easy prey, and it is not true that they call it hard work.But looking at the accounts of those who have connected, we can conclude that they are the same cheaters and scammers. That is, if they do not deceive, there will be someone who will deceive them.It is useless to warn anyone; people must grow on their own, drawing their own conclusions. Otherwise, you are creating an even bigger army of lazy people who, after promoting fraud, come here and start complaining that everyone around them is to blame, and that they did not receive their payments.
